title: Lecture 00
text:
So begins “Understanding Uncertainty”, a course in statistical thinking and data science.
This is lecture 0. See the syllabus for an overview of the course.
Our basic goals for the course are:

to build a strong intuition about data, where it comes from, and what questions it can answer.
to learn the basic computational skills needed to manipulate and analyze data. Working with data also helps with (1)!

title: Lecture 00
text:
Why statistics?
Statistics is, essentially, the study of data and how to use it. People argue about the purpose of statistics, but basically you can do 3 things with data: (1) description, (2) inference, and (3) prediction.

title: Syllabus
text:
Course Title: Understanding Uncertainty: An Introduction to Statistics through Data Generating Processes and Computational Simulations
Course Schedule: 4 Weeks, 3 sessions per week, 1.5 hours per session









Week
Session
Topics Covered
Activities/Assignments




1
Session 1
- Course Introduction- Understanding Data Generating Processes (DGPs)- Basic Python Syntax and Data Types
- Install Python and Jupyter- Assignment: Write a simple Python program



Session 2
- Data Structures in Python (Lists, Tuples, Dictionaries)- Importing and Exporting Data- Generating Random Numbers
- Load and explore datasets- Assignment: Simulate a simple DGP



Session 3
- Descriptive Statistics- Measures of Central Tendency and Variability- Data Visualization with Matplotlib and Seaborn
- Plot histograms and boxplots- Assignment: Analyze summary statistics of a dataset


2
Session 4
- Probability Concepts- Discrete and Continuous Distributions- Simulating Random Events
- Simulate coin tosses and dice rolls- Assignment: Probability simulations



Session 5
- Exploring Different Distributions- Normal, Binomial, Poisson, Exponential Distributions- Central Limit Theorem (CLT)
- Visualize distributions and CLT demonstrations- Assignment: CLT simulation project



Session 6
- Understanding Uncertainty- Confidence Intervals- Margin of Error- Introduction to Hypothesis Testing
- Calculate confidence intervals- Assignment: Formulate and test hypotheses


3
Session 7
- Resampling Methods- Bootstrapping and Permutation Tests- Practical Applications
- Conduct bootstrap and permutation tests- Assignment: Resampling project



Session 8
- Bias and Variance Trade-off- Overfitting and Underfitting- Model Complexity and Generalization
- Visualize bias-variance trade-off- Assignment: Experiment with model complexity



Session 9
- Introduction to Machine Learning- Supervised vs. Unsupervised Learning- Training and Testing Sets- Evaluation Metrics
- Split data and evaluate models- Assignment: Build and evaluate predictive models


4
Session 10
- Regularization Techniques- Ridge and Lasso Regression- Fairness in Machine Learning
- Implement regularization- Assignment: Regularization and fairness assessment



Session 11
- Population Statistics and Representation- Sampling Methods and Sampling Bias- Ethical Considerations in Data Science
- Simulate sampling strategies- Assignment: Design a fair sampling plan



Session 12
- Course Review and Future Directions- Student Project Presentations- Trends in Statistics and Data Science
- Present final projects- Course Feedback Survey
